snippet: Despite slow demand for hybrid and all-electric cars, tightening rules on fuel efficiency have led to the introduction of many new models at the Detroit auto show.
abstract: General Motors and Hyundai introduce new electric cars at annual Detroit auto show; sales of electric vehicles have been slow due to low fuel prices and more efficient gasoline engines; carmakers sold only 120,000 electric and hybrid vehicles in 2014, out of 16.5 million total vehicles sold.
lead_paragraph: Despite slow demand for hybrid and all-electric cars, tightening rules on fuel efficiency have led to the introduction of many new models at the Detroit auto show.

headline.main: G.M. Reboots Chevrolet Volt as Automakers Push Electric Cars
